column1: Acute cerebellar ataxia is sudden, uncoordinated muscle movement due to disease or injury to the cerebellum in the brain.
- Infections may need to be treated with antibiotics or antivirals.
- Steroids may be needed for swelling (inflammation) of the cerebellum (such as from multiple sclerosis) - Cerebellar ataxia caused by a recent viral infection may not need treatment.
Strokes, bleeding, or infections may cause permanent symptoms.
